intro: Halimium atlanticum, commonly known as the Atlantic rock rose, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It features dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has woody stems and hairy leaves, adapted to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. It is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun, making it suitable for rocky gardens and coastal landscapes. Halimium atlanticum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
